page.title: 16RECREATION - THE CANAL
page.content: The canal is now used as a{Country {Park.}From the basin in Canal Hill the first mile is lined either side by houses. Many of the occupants own {boats}or canoes. Motorised vessels are not allowed. Nine year old children are given the opportunity to go canoeing from school. The tow path is used by people for {leisure}and{exercising their dogs. This causes problems as the path is left fouled by the dogs. The{bank}is full of wild flowers and birds, whilst the water supports fish, frogs and water fowl. Two{barges}drawn by shire horses carry{passengers}several miles along the canal. They are decorated traditionally with flowers and castles although one has the Tiverton coat of arms painted on it. {(Refer also to pages 13 & 17.)
